meanings.definition: To manage jointly or in partnership with others.
meanings.sent1: My friend and I comanage our small business, sharing responsibilities equally.
meanings.sent2: The team decided to comanage the project to ensure it was completed efficiently.
meanings.sent3: It's like a teamwork dance when we comanage the household chores.
meanings.sent4: We comanage the company like two captains steering the same ship.
meanings.sent5: Comanaging the event made us realize the power of collaboration.

meanings.definition: The act of managing something together with others.
meanings.sent1: Comanage requires effective communication and cooperation among all parties involved.
meanings.sent2: The comanage of the project led to a successful outcome for everyone.
meanings.sent3: The comanage of the community garden brought neighbors closer together.
meanings.sent4: In the comanage of the event, each person played a crucial role.
meanings.sent5: The comanage of resources is essential for sustainable development.
